lead_paragraph: Mr. Zhai worked for a Beijing law firm that was at the center of the crackdown on human rights lawyers last year, which ensnared about 250 people.

headline.print_headline: Chinese Human Rights Advocate Gets a Suspended 3-Year Term
headline.main: Zhai Yanmin, Chinese Rights Activist, Gets Suspended Prison Term

snippet: Mr. Zhai worked for a Beijing law firm that was at the center of the crackdown on human rights lawyers last year, which ensnared about 250 people....
abstract: Chinese court sentences human rights activist Zhai Yanmin to suspended three-year term for allegedly subverting state power; Zhai is not expected to serve, but sentence is display of Communist Party's hard-line attitude toward dissent.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
